page.title: 03BEDSWORTH FARM
page.content: Mr Moakes who owns Bedsworth Farm allowed us to visit his farm and interview him. Bedsworth farmhouse was built in the 1600's and it was then known as Beetleworth Hall.This building is still used as the family home. The farm has both old and new buildings.The old barns are used for keeping animals and the new ones are used for storing hay and vegetables that have been grown on the farm. Mr Moakes has always worked on the farm and took the farm over when his father died. The farm now has twenty-five cows,for beef production and seventeen pigs.All the cattle are sold at Stratford Market during May and June. Mr Moakes cannot imagine not working on his farm and hopes that one day his son will take it over.
